meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'swingy': having a lot of swing or movement.
meanings.sent1: The swingier branches of the tree danced in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The playground was much swingier after they added the new swings.
meanings.sent3: The swingier monkey made the others jealous with its acrobatics.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was swingier than a pendulum, constantly changing.
meanings.sent5: The swingier music made everyone want to get up and dance.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'swingy': lively and exciting.
meanings.sent1: The swingier party had everyone laughing and dancing all night.
meanings.sent2: The swingier atmosphere at the concert made it unforgettable.
meanings.sent3: The swingier puppy kept everyone entertained with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her jokes were swingier than a trapeze artist, always landing perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The swingier movie had us on the edge of our seats with excitement.
